html:
ABUJA, Jan 19 (Reuters) - Shares of Airtel Africa AAF.L hit an all-time high on Wednesday, soaring the maximum 10% permitted and lifting Nigeria's main stock index.

The main share index .NGSEINDEX climbed 1.73% to 45,430.14 points, a level last seen in January 2018.

Airtel is Nigeria's third-biggest listed firm.




(Reporting by Chijioke Ohuocha; Editing by Kirsten Donovan)

(( chijioke.ohuocha@thomsonreuters.com ; +234 703 4180 621; Reuters Messaging: chijioke.ohuocha.thomsonreuters@reuters.net ))
